p: Virus pathology per se commonly shows heterogeneity in its outcome, as it causes severe disease only in some affected patients. The current SARS-CoV2 pandemic in 2019/2020 is an overwhelming example of the array of outcomes of virus infection in different people, depending, e.g., on age, genetic background and pre-existing disease, from asymptomatic to pathologic [ 13]. There is a bidirectional relationship between Covid-19 and diabetes [ 14]. Firstly, several rapid communications have associated SARS-CoV2 with acute-onset diabetes [ 14, 15], and, secondly, patients with diabetes are at greater risk for severe Covid-19 illness.
